summary: This is an email chain from July 27, 2020, between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorneys for the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. It confirms the estate will not retaliate against employees who cooperate with law enforcement, will not make distributions to Ghislaine Maxwell without notifying prosecutors, and will not waive attorney-client privilege for seized materials.

keyFacts: The co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate confirm they will not use trust provisions to retaliate against employees who cooperate with law enforcement investigations.
The estate has not made any distributions to Ghislaine Maxwell and agrees to notify the U.S. Attorney's Office before any disbursement to her during her pending criminal case.
The estate refuses to waive attorney-client privilege for materials seized by the government at this time.
This correspondence highlights ongoing legal coordination between Epstein's estate and federal prosecutors regarding the management of estate assets and cooperation with investigations.
